title: ONYX STORM
author: Rebecca Yarros
description: The third book in the Empyrean series. As enemies gain traction, Violet Sorrengail goes beyond the Aretian wards in search of allies.

title: THE CRASH
author: Freida McFadden
description: A pregnant woman, who suffers an injury during a blizzard, is taken in by a couple who might put her life in further jeopardy.

title: FOURTH WING
author: Rebecca Yarros
description: Violet Sorrengail is urged by the commanding general, who also is her mother, to become a candidate for the elite dragon riders.

title: IRON FLAME
author: Rebecca Yarros
description: The second book in the Empyrean series. Violet Sorrengail’s next round of training under the new vice commandant might require her to betray the man she loves.

title: THE HOUSEMAID
author: Freida McFadden
description: Troubles surface when a woman looking to make a fresh start takes a job in the home of the Winchesters.

title: THE SIRENS' CALL
author: Chris Hayes
description: The MSNBC host considers the ways in which attention capitalism affects politics and society.

title: ON TYRANNY
author: Timothy Snyder
description: Twenty lessons from the 20th century about the course of tyranny.

title: HILLBILLY ELEGY
author: JD Vance
description: The vice president, in a memoir written shortly after graduating from Yale Law School, looks at the struggles of the white working class through the story of his own childhood.

title: THE ANXIOUS GENERATION
author: Jonathan Haidt
description: A co-author of “The Coddling of the American Mind” looks at the mental health impacts that a phone-based life has on children.

title: MELANIA
author: Melania Trump
description: The first lady describes her work as a fashion model, marriage to Donald Trump and time in the White House.

title: IMPOSSIBLE CREATURES
author: Katherine Rundell. Illustrated Ashley Mackenzie
description: A young boy is enlisted to save a place where magical creatures reside. (Ages 10 and up)

title: WONDER
author: R.J. Palacio
description: A boy with a facial deformity starts school. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: THE COMPLETE COOKBOOK FOR YOUNG CHEFS
author: America's Test Kitchen Kids
description: Over 100 kid-tested recipes from America's Test Kitchen. (Ages 8 and up)

title: PRICELESS FACTS ABOUT MONEY
author: Mellody Hobson. Illustrated Caitlin Stevens
description: Elucidating money for kids. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: THE FIRST STATE OF BEING
author: Erin Entrada Kelly
description: In 1999, a 12-year-old meets a time traveler from 2199. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: LITTLE BLUE TRUCK'S VALENTINE
author: Alice Schertle. Illustrated Jill McElmurry
description: Little Blue Truck delivers Valentine's Day cards to all his farm animal friends. (Ages 4 and up)

title: LOVE FROM BLUEY
author: Suzy Brumm
description: The love between parents and their children. (Ages 5 to 8)

title: HOW TO CATCH A LOVEOSAURUS
author: Alice Walstead. Illustrated Andy Elkerton
description: The Catch Club Kids attempt to catch a dinosaur that wants to spread love and kindness. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: LOVE FROM THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR
author: Eric Carle
description: A ravenous insect returns with its appetite intact. (Ages 3 to 5)

title: GRUMPY MONKEY VALENTINE GROSS-OUT
author: Suzanne Lang. Illustrated Max Lang
description: Jim Panzee believes that Valentine's Day is gross, especially kissing! (Ages 4 to 8)

title: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID
author: written and illustrated Jeff Kinney
description: The travails and challenges of adolescence. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: THE WILD ROBOT
author: Peter Brown
description: Roz the robot adapts to her surroundings on a remote, wild island. (Ages 7 to 12)

title: HARRY POTTER
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A wizard hones his conjuring skills in the service of fighting evil. (Ages 10 and up)

title: LIGHTLARK SAGA
author: Alex Aster
description: Every 100 years the island of Lightlark appears and a deadly competition called the Centennial takes place. (Ages 13 and up)

title: PERCY JACKSON & THE OLYMPIANS
author: Rick Riordan
description: A boy battles mythological monsters. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: IF HE HAD BEEN WITH ME
author: Laura Nowlin
description: The coming-of-age love story of Autumn and Phineas. (Ages 14 to 18)

title: NOTHING LIKE THE MOVIES
author: Lynn Painter
description: In this sequel to "Better Than the Movies," Wes tries to win back the heart of Liz. (Ages 14 and up)

title: A STUDY IN DROWNING
author: Ava Reid
description: Dark forces try to thwart Preston and Effy's efforts to unravel the mysteries of author Emrys Myrddin's Hiraeth Manor. (Ages 14 and up)

title: THE LAST BOOKSTORE ON EARTH
author: Lily Braun-Arnold
description: In a dystopian future, Liz and Maeve survive together in an abandoned bookstore. (Ages 12 and up)

title: MURTAGH
author: Christopher Paolini
description: Murtagh and his dragon, Thorn, must find and outwit a mysterious witch. (Ages 12 to 15)
